comment.author: 29809546@N00
comment._content:
Inferred hat etiquette: Ladies, but not gentlemen, may remove their hats while enjoying  afternoon tea.

It seems they can also toss their titfers to the ground.

comment.author: 29809546@N00
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/92700232@N04] Another picture with hats on the ground!

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: I think this may be it from the mountain shapes behind. Look at the great view to the left - a great place for a cuppa! GoogleMapsStreetView

comment.author: 29809546@N00
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/92700232@N04] And the lady about to serve the scones can be seen in the other Glencar Teahouse photo pouring tea (or pretending to - nothing is coming out of the spout)

comment.author: 30369211@N00
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/beachcomberaustralia] That spot is also near where you would leave the road to climb to the Waterfall:

comment.author: 77199267@N03
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/beachcomberaustralia] Yes, that fits with the OS Map as well. They are sitting on the lawn between the driveway and the footpath looking out over the lake, possibly after a visit to the Waterfall [http://www.flickr.com/photos/gnmcauley/] or maybe even a boat ride on the lake here

comment.author: 77199267@N03
comment._content: ...and of course that would put it back in Co. Leitrim not Sligo!

comment._content: Thanks one and all! Added this, the 1990, and the "stray" Tea House one (which to my shame, I'd completely forgotten) to our Flickr Map...

comment.author: 16489083@N05
comment.authorname: maorlando God kept us 2012 leaning on Him 2013

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: It looks like such an ideal place for enjoying the view of the lake and mountains with a cup of tea, fresh-baked scones and butter, home-made strawberry jam and a dollop of thick cream, the smell of newly-cut lawn and a turf fire, and some delicious gossip ... ...  But the customers do not look at all happy - have the menfolk gone off fishing and walking without them, or what? The Grumps!

comment.author: 75556178@N05
comment._content: The frozen look on the faces was probably because the photographer asked them to "freeze" as he was taking the photograph.

comment.author: 82249851@N08
comment._content: Thank you for posting this, reading the story to this and about the later project is really fascinating!

comment._content: This is in Sligo, and is up the road from the Barite Mines (1800's) and Grainne & Dermot's cave.
